private_information: May only touch vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
May only move the top block of a stack when that top block is a vowel (A, E, I)
V-agent.goal: Help achieve the final two-stack arrangement: Stack1 A-B-D-E and Stack2 F-C-I-G, while respecting my touch restrictions and single-hold rule.

private_information: May only touch consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
May only move the top block of a stack when that top block is a consonant (B, C, D, F, G)
C-agent.goal: Help achieve the final two-stack arrangement: Stack1 A-B-D-E and Stack2 F-C-I-G, while respecting my touch restrictions and single-hold rule.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate V-agent and C-agent to produce a valid PDDL domain and problem that achieves the final arrangement while enforcing all constraints (top-only moves, single hold, blocking rule, stack cap ≤ 3, and agent-specific touch restrictions).

requirements: A is on the table (bottom of stack1)
F is on the table (bottom of stack2)
C on F, I on C, G on I
B on A, D on B, E on D
Exactly two nonempty stacks on the table with the specified orders

public_information: There are eight blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, I
V-agent may only touch vowel blocks (A, E, I); C-agent may only touch consonant blocks (B, C, D, F, G)
Only the top block of a stack may be moved
Each agent can hold at most one block at a time
An agent holding a block prevents the other agent from placing a block on the held block
At most 3 stacks may exist on the table at any time
Blocks may be placed on top of existing stacks or on the table (creating a new stack if table capacity allows)

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modelling. You will be provided environment initial state, public facts, and private constraints for two agents that must cooperate. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the blocks world described, including agent-specific action capabilities, single-hold constraints, top-only moves, blocking rule, and table stack cap. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct by agent (e.g., move-vagent, move-cagent) and ensure the model prevents any move that would violate the constraints. Do not add assumptions beyond the provided information.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
V-agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->V-agent->private_information}.
C-agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->C-agent->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
